Posts.Title: Lets do a Sh*t People say to Metastatic BC Patients Fitztwins ChicagoGirl

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2013 04:14PM AZhiker wrote: My mom just started Xeloda/Taxotere regime on Wednesday - tomorrow will be the first day of the second week of Xeloda.  She's really tired and not much appetite, but we're trying to get her to REST, HYDRATE and EAT.  Hoping for the best with this protocol.  Any wisdom or advice?
Posts.Title: Xeloda and Taxotere combo EllsJen5 stagefree

Posts.Content: AZhiker wrote: Mom was diagnosed stage IV ER+/HER2- in 1/2012.  After 8 months on AIs (letrozole/anastrozole, fulvestrant combo) Mom started Afinitor in 9/2012. As of 2/2013, tumor markers are high, but stable. At onc appt this week, Dr. indicated cytotoxic chemo will be next when Afinitor no longer "holds the line" or if mom can't tolerate the SEs. Aftre Afinitor, are other options besides chemo?  I thought I read on previous posts that some Oncs prescribe AIs again after Afinitor.  Now I can't find this particular thread.  What has been other's experience with treatment options after AIs then Afinitor?   Appreciate any insight!  Thanks! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: What's after Afinitor? AZhiker AZhiker

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2013 12:17PM AZhiker wrote: Thank you Mary and Chickadee.  I think we've been on a primrose path (of sorts) with the AIs and mom's been able to keep BC under wraps in the small town where she lives.  Next step will be more outwardly visible, so that will be a big change for her if the SEs are what you might expect.  Like so many, she wants to be seen as strong, vibrant, and mostly normal.....  Really appreciate your responses.
